##Jin Dongyan, virologist: It's almost impossible to cure a patient who has a second attack in a short period of time

I-CAIJING

CAIJING magazine official Wechat. "CAIJING" magazine, sponsored by the China Securities Market Research Center, was first published in 1998, adhering to the news concept of "independence, exclusiveness and originality" , and is known for authoritative, impartial and professional reporting, it is a must-read publication for policy-makers, researchers and managers in the field of politics and economics.

The following article is from Latepost, the author of the late team

Later. Better. It is a new brand launched by CAIJING magazine in collaboration with Xiaowan's team. All first-hand interviews, no second-hand information. Be Your most trusted business news outlet.

"treating a virus with hormones is like drinking poison to quench thirst. SARS, Mers, or now COVID-19, looked like an instant hit with steroids. If we treat the symptoms but not the root cause, the virus will surge up, and the chances of infection among health care workers will increase. There are even people who can become super-spreaders after hormone therapy, which is very dangerous."

![img](data:image/jpeg;base64,)
By Ji Lu, CAIJING magazine

Editor | Song Wei

History has shown time and again that the best way to fight an epidemic is with science and truth.

Shortly after the COVID-19(SARS-CoV-2) outbreak in Wuhan, a team led by Professor Yuen Kwok-yung of the University of Hong Kong began studying cluster infections in family groups. The study found a high rate of viral attack in close family contact, with 83 percent of the entire family infected. The study, published Jan. 24 in the Lancet, is the first internationally conclusive evidence that the virus is not only capable of human to human transmission, but that it is very capable of doing so at this stage.

At the time, the HKU study had sent a clear signal that there was a high risk of cluster infection in the home.

But on January 28, the National Health and COVID-19 released the third edition of the pneumonia prevention and control program, which states: When a strong epidemic occurs in the local area, when medical resources are tight, mild cases and asymptomatic infection can be taken at home treatment and observation.

The team also found an asymptomatic infected person with mild lung CT abnormalities and viral nucleic acid in sputum, the first warning of asymptomatic infection to spread the virus. It provided the important scientific basis for the country to deal with the epidemic situation decisively.

Since then, many cases in Wuhan proved that close contact with the patients with family members have also become ill. More cases have been diagnosed in clusters of families across the country. On February 21, the National Health Commission released the fifth edition of the Prevention and Control Program, the new version of the program amended to: Asymptomatic infection should be concentrated in isolation for 14 days.

Wuhan "closed" nearly a month, exposed China's medical system and infectious disease prevention and treatment of certain weaknesses. This is reflected in the timeliness of the announcement of the epidemic, the allocation of medical resources, but also reflected in a number of areas of research: including the scarcity of high-level clinical research, high-level Epidemiological Research Gaps; Diagnostic Reagents and drug research technologies are in short supply; are medical care, Disease Control and virology research working as a team, or are they too busy to communicate?

Virologist Jin Dongyan knows this all too well. He has been working on coronaviruses since 2003. He recalled that after the SARS outbreak 17 years ago, "there could be thousands of scientists in China studying coronaviruses. " But after the disappearance of SARS, "the research also stopped, followed the trend of the more and adhere to the very few, fully shows some Chinese scholars impetuous and quick success and instant benefit. ". He said.

Jin Dongyan is a Molecular virology at the Li Ka Shing Faculty of Medicine's Li Ka Shing School of Medicine. In 1982, he enrolled in biochemistry at the National Sun Yat-sen University; later, he studied for a doctor's degree at the Chinese Academy of Preventive Medicine and worked at the Institute of Virology; later, he went to the National Institutes of Health to do postdoctoral research; Returned to China in 1999 and has taught at the University of Hong Kong. He has been involved in the molecular biology of oncoviruses and their interactions with cells for many years, making him one of the most internationally recognized Principal investigator in the field. In 2020, he was just elected a fellow of the American Academy of Microbial Sciences.

Microbiology and pathology play an important role in the British and American medical systems, Jin said. However, the experts of microbiology, infectious diseases and pathology in our hospital have not been able to play a guiding role in other departments and even the whole hospital. Including this outbreak, the autopsy work, which has been called on for a long time, is a direct manifestation of this neglect of pathology.

Viruses are terrible. Humans shouldn't have to make the same mistakes over and over again.

The following is an interview with Professor Jin Dongyan by CAIJING:

"It is against the basic principles of virology and immunology that people who recover immediately reinfect themselves. "

"CAIJING" : recently there is news that the patient recovered from the illness and was discharged from hospital with a second illness. The test result is Shuangyang. There's speculation that there's some variation in the SARS-CoV-2 virus, so as a virologist, what do you think?

Jin Dongyan: The convalescent immediately reinfection, which is completely against the basic principles of virology and immunology. The human body relies on the immune response against the virus, the immune response after the encounter of the virus will be activated, not in a short period of time quickly subsided. No more infections for at least six months, a year.

The mutation rate of the SARS-COV-2 virus is significantly lower than that of the SARS-CoV, and there is no evidence that it mutates rapidly enough to cause immune escape. A 2006 study by Academician Zhong Nanshan's team showed that protective IgG neutralizing antibodies could still be detected in recovered SARS patients for at least two years. It can be inferred that the SARS-CoV situation should be similar to this. (Note: IgG Antibodies are protective neutralizing antibodies, which means you've been exposed to the Antigen.)

The healer has antibodies, high and low. When the same or very similar antigen is encountered again, the antibody immune system is stimulated, but also a large number of antibody production. It is one of the feasible methods to treat the patients with severe disease by using the antibody of the cured person. It would be almost inconceivable that the healer could be immediately reinfected. If that's true, then there's no need to develop a vaccine.

We in vaccine research often say that the best vaccine is no disease or very mild infection. If the actual infection isn't protective, the vaccine won't work either.

"CAIJING" : The National Health Commission New Coronavirus Diagnosis and treatment program proposed "Serum Therapy" is to cure the serum antibodies to treat critically ill patients.

Jin Dongyan: Using the patient's convalescent serum to treat patients with severe illness, this is always good, it is worth a try.

Antibody therapy works the same way that the virus is cleared by the body's normal production of antibodies in the later stages of infection, except that it borrows antibodies produced by others, hence passive immunity. In contrast, active immunization produces antibodies that neutralize the virus after vaccination. Both passive and active immunization achieve the goal of suppressing and eliminating the virus.

But "serum therapy" is also a side effect, the serum may have unknown pathogens, there may be allergens can cause allergic reactions. Using someone else's antibodies is similar in nature to blood transfusions, which are emergency, and only for critically ill patients.

CAIJING: Lei Xuezhong, a member of the Sichuan Expert Group on medical treatment of new-coronavirus pneumonia, said that cases diagnosed after recovery were "more likely to be the persistent remnants of a small number of viruses. ". Is there an academic term for "viral residue" ?

JINDONGYAN: It's not a scientific language for the virus to persist. In the case of a persistent infection, unless the patient is immunocompromised, the likelihood is extremely low.

In theory, patients may be asymptomatic after passing the virus through the stool or intestinal tract often for a period of time, there have been some reports in the past. But this kind of situation is rare, also not this kind of situation now, should not magnify with the psychology of curiosity.

CAIJING: What do you think is the most likely cause of a patient's "second relapse" ?

Jin Dongyan: the most likely is to leave the hospital when the uncertainty, to admit that this is the most direct.

The NUCLEIC ACID test may be false negative after recovery, or the virus load is reduced because of reagent sensitivity and sampling and other relations not detected. If you want to rule out the probability of uncertainty, should be measured at the same time antibody, for example, antibody has more than four times high is to enter the recovery period. The best way to do that is to mass-produce antibody reagents to aid in the diagnosis, and then explain it for some other strange reason, which is against the grain of common sense.

CAIJING: Is there sequela in those cured of new coronary pneumonia?

Jin Dongyan: it can't be worse than SARS at present. Many of the sequelae of SARS are in fact the sequelae of hormone therapy rather than SARS itself. In the case of SARS, the vast majority of patients recover completely, although critically ill patients take longer to recover fully.

"CAIJING" : We now have the information that there are cured patients with pulmonary fibrosis still exist.

Jin Dongyan: Pulmonary fibrosis is indeed irreversible, but there is no cure.

However, previous studies have shown that the local pulmonary fibrosis caused by SARS-CoV infection can be absorbed and cleared, and finally completely self-healing, but it takes some time. Severe cases and older patients recover more slowly, but most people are able to recover 100 percent.

"CAIJING" : Why the new coronavirus pneumonia infection will present the early symptoms are not obvious, long incubation period, strong infectious and relatively low mortality characteristics?

Jin Dongyan: between the virus and the host is the interaction mutual antagonism relations, I compared it to "tug of war" . In this process, the virus and its host adapt to each other -- as a virus adapts to a person, or a person adapts to a virus.

It is not appropriate to say that viruses are cunning, because that is the natural order of their evolution. As the virus becomes more infectious, it becomes less pathogenic. That's how the virus adapts to the human body, but that doesn't mean it's any different.

On the contrary, the infectious weak virus, the pathogenicity is quite strong, this is the general rule. When this virus infects the early stage symptom is not obvious, even appears the asymptomatic infection person, really brings the very big challenge for the epidemic prevention. The task at hand is not to continue to debate whether these phenomena exist, but to quickly identify their significance and role in the actual spread of the virus. Specifically, it is important to know what percentage of the population these conditions represent, whether they are less contagious, and whether the patients who are infected by these individuals are less symptomatic.

I would add that the incubation period for this virus infection is similar to that of the SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV, and typically does not exceed one week. There is no evidence that the incubation period is particularly long.

CAIJING: Everyone is talking about the variability of the virus. Is there any possibility that it could mutate into another form in the near future?

Jin Dongyan: There must be some variation. But its mutation rate is relatively low compared to that of the SARS-CoV.

The source of the SARS-CoV is bats, which are well adapted to the virus, but the virus may not be well adapted to higher mammals. The MERS-CoV intermediate host is the camel, the camel has the morbidity but is not serious, indicated that this virus has already adapted the camel. But the symptoms caused by its infection in humans are so severe that it is presumed to have not been sufficiently adapted in humans.

So did SARS-COV-2 also pass through an intermediate host, which may have been more adaptive to this intermediate host, and this unknown intermediate host may be closer to humans. So SARS-COV-2 has a lower mutation rate? That's one theory.

CAIJING: Does this mean it will hardly turn into a more deadly virus?

Golden Goose: from an evolutionary point of view, evolution is to benefit the virus itself. It becomes a stronger virus, which is not good for it, because it kills all its hosts, and it has nowhere to hide and no place to breed. To mutate into a particularly vicious, highly virulent virus, which is an accident, which doesn't fit the general pattern, which is very unlikely.

According to the results of the study, there was a difference of 6 nucleotides between the virus strains detected in Hong Kong and Wuhan, indicating little change. The entire SARS-CoV-2 virus has 30,000 nucleotides, six of which make up a tiny fraction. (Note: nucleotides are the genetic material of viruses, controlling their replication and determining their properties.)

"We don't win if the virus disappears. We lose if it doesn't. "

CAIJING: When is the inflection point of epidemic situation likely to arrive? What's the sign of arrival?

Jin Dongyan: the most important thing is to grasp the facts, the actual situation of the epidemic area, in the end, "the enemy" how strong. I can not predict when it will reach its peak. I can not say with confidence that it will reach its peak point. This is because up to now I do not have a first-hand grasp of the actual situation, so I do not know.

If there are still many people who have not been diagnosed, there are many asymptomatic infections, he does not feel sick, a sore throat over, may have been infected to others, this is very dangerous. Now the actual situation is very unclear, do not find out how to set up prevention and control strategies?

In the future, there will be only two scenarios. One is that the virus will disappear completely in humans, like the SARS-CoV, which is highly pathogenic but not Kalanchoe Pinnata in humans. The other scenario is that the virus is fully adapted to humans and highly infectious but less pathogenic, becoming another community-acquired human coronavirus.

If that happens, we can eliminate SARS-CoV-2 completely in humans with vaccines, just as we can eliminate smallpox and Enterovirus C with vaccines.

CAIJING: The virus completely disappeared and fully adapted to human beings. What's Your judgment?

Jin Dongyan: it's no big deal whether it actually disappears or not. We don't win if it disappears. We lose if it doesn't.

We need to be prepared for both situations, and each has its own strategy for dealing with them. As long as the appropriate response, in any case, human beings can still achieve the final complete victory.

CAIJING: If the latter happens, what will humanity face?

Jin Dongyan: It is necessary to do everything possible to save as many critically ill patients as possible before the virus weakens. Now about 10%-20% of people with severe illness, need to use the ICU, the mortality rate is 2% , 1% or less, Wuhan is about 3% .

We need to identify critical patients early, and bring these people back to life, which is the biggest clinical task right now. Lives are at stake.

CAIJING: The epidemic has now spread around the world, including in countries with hot climates. Is it impossible that people had hoped it would disappear with the heat like the SARS epidemic?

Golden Goose: SARS-CoV is due to measures such as prevention, control and isolation slowly play a role, and the transmission of the virus after human generations has also weakened, so in the heat before the epidemic subsided. Viruses that spread from animals across the interspecies barrier to humans often disappear spontaneously for unknown reasons. As for the cause of the disappearance, temperature is not necessarily the key. The temperature in Singapore has been high, but SARS-CoV-2 still has some spread.

Sars-cov-2 is transmitted to the third, fourth or more generations of human beings, whether the transmission is weakened, and whether there is any change in the pathogenicity, all of which are of great concern and should be determined as soon as possible. If the spread of the virus is indeed weakened and all prevention and control measures play a role, the epidemic may still end. There have been many other viral infections in history, such as HIV jumping from primates to humans, and only three or four times out of a dozen have been successful.

But today the virus broke out in Wuhan, and now 50,000 to 60,000 people have been infected. People at First Laughed at Professor Guan Yi for saying 10x jump, but I think he has a point. Looking back now, at least he was right. It was a 10x jump.

If you get a certain number of infections, you just have to wait for the herd to become immune, and then when 30 percent, 40 percent, or more of the population has antibodies, there's resistance to transmission, and it gets bigger and bigger, and it doesn't spread at all, and it stops. If we don't, we're gonNA need a vaccine.

"without a thorough understanding of the basic situation, any strategy is unjustifiable. "

CAIJING: will this epidemic break out on a global scale?

Jin Dongyan: the spread of the virus in many countries and regions is still early, hard to say.

"CAIJING" : Different countries and regions treat the new crown very different strategies, domestic mandatory isolation, Japan does not advocate isolation, Singapore's prevention and control is also relatively loose.

Jin Dongyan: different decision-making, different ways to the same goal. Hong Kong, China is trying to block, can not block as much as possible to slow down the spread of the virus. 'If the transmission reaches a certain level, we will abandon close contacts and focus on treating critically ill patients, ' Singapore said. Because all viral disease have a pattern, and some are hard to stop.

CAIJING: Is it a bad decision that the diamond princess chose to isolate all crew members on board, resulting in infection from 1 to 621 on board?

Jin Dongyan: After the ship to see the isolation effect is indeed bad, but the problem is where to find out first, and then specific analysis of the specific situation. Would you just put the people on the boat ashore and quarantine them? I don't know. If the isolation method is not correct, whether on board or on shore, the effect will not be good.

CAIJING: What about the 17 percent infection rate on the diamond princess?

Golden Winter Goose: The SARS-CoV super-spread event occurred in Amoy Gardens of Hong Kong in the past. First, the source of the kidney dialysis patient may be due to immunosuppression and release of large amounts of virus, and then may be transmitted through sewage pipe formation of Aerosol.

The current diamond princess may also have had a superspreader, and it remains to be seen whether the virus is spreading through ventilation, sewage, food, or something else. You keep people in there, you call it quarantine, but it's still 50,60,100 new cases a day, and it's not working.

Similarly, Wuhan, the virus is in the end through what way in the spread? Is it in the home, in the hospital, in the community, up and down the stairs, through the septic system, garbage, ventilation systems? It is very dangerous for you to go blind without knowing the situation.

Now it is reported that there are already antigen antibody detection reagents, should be put into production as soon as possible, real realization of a drop of blood can quickly detect the patient's antigen antibody. Those with IgG antibodies may have been infected in the past, and those with antigens or IGM antibodies may be infected. (Note: Igm Antibodies are the first antibodies to appear in primates after infection.)

Now do nucleic acid detection technology is difficult, then we should hurry up to do antigen antibody detection reagents, through Antigen antibody detection to understand the basic situation, otherwise do any strategy is a tree without roots.

CAIJING: It's a lot of work to do an antigen antibody test on all confirmed and suspected patients.

Jin Dongyan: We want to dissect sparrows, can start from a few representative residential quarters or units. Efforts should be made to understand this basic epidemic, Seek truth from facts, and then to design and even change the strategy of prevention and control. The test should include not only confirmed and suspected patients, but also all healthy people in the community or unit. By testing to find out how many people have recovered from the infection, how many people are infected, and how many people asymptomatic or mild virus.

Our prevention and control strategy needs to be set up and revised according to the actual situation. For example, in cases of high infection rates, it is no longer possible to isolate a large number of close contacts in a concentrated manner, as it no longer makes sense to isolate close contacts when there are already a large number of infected persons. He takes up the bed so that patients who are really sick or seriously ill can not be admitted.

CAIJING: Why is the case fatality rate in Hubei far higher than that in other areas?

Jin Dongyan: the mortality rate outside of Hubei is about 0.6 percent as far as we can see. The hospital mortality rate of influenza is 2% to 3% , in absolute terms, the number of deaths from influenza is not small. We generally believe that the situation outside Hubei Province is relatively close to the real, because of rich medical resources, many places desperate to find all the patients. Which means if we do this right, we can lower the fatality rate.

The reason for the higher fatality rate in Wuhan may be that the treatment of severe cases was not timely and appropriate, including some deaths from secondary infections that may have been caused by hormones; in fact, the denominator of the case fatality rate calculated in Wuhan may be much larger, because there are a lot of people who might not have been diagnosed, he's either asymptomatic or very mild, and he hasn't been to a doctor. Many may be cured and can only be detected by testing for antibodies.

Because of this, there is no condition to create the conditions must quickly find out the actual situation, to determine in accordance with the facts before re-judging.

"CAIJING" : How do you look at the city of Wuhan closed, if half a month earlier, ten days earlier closed city, how?

Jin Dongyan: The public health care system was overloaded when it was closed. At first it was the height of the flu, and many people went to the hospital with the flu, only to be infected by a small number of people infected with SARS-CoV-2.

Sealing off the city will work. But what does it do? Does it kill the virus, or just slow it down? More experts think it's slowing things down.

The success of the siege was in stopping the virus from escaping from Wuhan and Hubei. We sealed off the city to stop the flow of people. How's that working out? How many people are actually asymptomatic? How many people have mild infections? How many people were actually infected but did not seek medical attention? There are a lot of things that aren't clear right now.

After the blockade, the virus is still spreading, exactly how to spread, the competent departments should move, organize disease control and other forces, take great efforts to dissect sparrows, to find out the reason, we must not give up Wuhan.

"really high-level clinical research is important, and that's what we don't have right now. "

"CAIJING" : You have experienced the SARS epidemic, in contrast, this epidemic prevention and control of any progress? What else is missing?

Jin Dongyan: There are a lot of advances, such as quickly isolate the virus, sequence it, share it with the world and so on.

The deficiency, the most important, is the basic and clinical, clinical and disease control, the whole coordination is not enough. CDC (China Center for Disease Control) , Health Commission and Local Government Authority is not clear. The CDC has the CDC, the CDC has the HHS, there's no clear relationship. From the time of the outbreak until January 20th, the decision-making went awry, causing a delay of two to three weeks, a very painful lesson. We must sum it up well in the future.

CAIJING: Based on your observation, what are the implications of this outbreak for the health care system and the prevention and treatment of infectious diseases?

Jin Dongyan: This should wait until the end of the epidemic, or when the end of a serious summary, is still in progress.

At present, all aspects of their own, with poor coordination. The hospital is headed by the Hospital Authority, which is not aligned with disease control and virology research. The foundation does the foundation, the clinical does the clinical, the disease control does the disease control, everybody does not exchange.

From a research point of view, the University of Hong Kong in Shenzhen Hospital to do a family group study, January 24 in close contact with the virus in the family attack rate is high, 83% of family members were hit. The team also found a young patient who described herself as asymptomatic but with mild lung CT abnormalities and whose sputum revealed the nucleic acid of the SARS-CoV-2 virus, the first warning sign of asymptomatic transmission. This study provides a strong scientific basis for the formulation and modification of national epidemic prevention policies and initiatives.

Really high-level clinical research is critical, it can make a difference, and that's what we're missing. (Note: Family Group study refers to the investigation and analysis of the incidence of certain diseases among family members to show the transmission characteristics of certain diseases in families.)

CAIJING: In this epidemic prevention and control, the CDC, Health Commission and government departments, respectively, should assume any responsibility?

Jin Dongyan: the CDC mainly plays the role of technical guidance, the epidemic is announced in the Health Commission. We knew some of this before January 18th, but we didn't see an immediate release of the outbreak.

This time it has exposed some of the bottlenecks and weaknesses in our health care system and in the prevention and treatment of infectious diseases. Microbiology and pathology play an important role in the anglo-american system. But now our medical microbiology, infectious disease and pathology specialists are largely unable to guide the entire hospital. Including the long-delayed autopsy, the importance of pathology was overlooked.

CAIJING: What is the current situation you have observed regarding the clinical use of drugs?

Jin Dongyan: Standard Treatment, not arbitrary treatment. In the past, SARS was treated with hormones, which I have always been very opposed to. Treating viral diseases with hormones is nothing but poison to quench thirst.

SARS, Mers, or now NCP, appear to have an immediate effect with hormones that immediately reduce inflammation, or suppress cytokine storms. But by treating the symptoms rather than the root cause, the virus will surge, and the chances of infection among health care workers will increase. There are even some people who, after hormone therapy, can become super spreaders, which is very dangerous.

So anyone who uses steroids to treat a viral illness is just adding fuel to the fire. Recently, a hospital found a patient with a deep fungal infection, which may be related to hormones. After hormone use, fungi, chlamydia and other pathogens came one after another. Only when the virus is completely controlled can the hormone play the role of slowing the cytokine storm. The window of its action is very narrow, so we must use it carefully.

Various other trial drugs, including interferon, have toxic side effects. For example, Interferon may play an anti-viral role in the early stage of viral infection, but in the later stage of infection, it often has more serious side effects and may play a role in fuelling cytokine storms. Therefore, even if there is a clear anti-viral effect of Interferon, the use should still be cautious.

So the treatment is also the need for consensus, the need for medical virologists, clinical virologists and critical care medicine, smoking division, all aspects of communication and cooperation. Irregular treatment can be dangerous.

Read more about the outbreak in pictures
